acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours LC50=6.7mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2005).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >1.24mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 840mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no evidence of treatment-related incidence of tumor formation observed in mouse carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (log Kow=3.07(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 21%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 91.0degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests and in vivo chromosome aberration tests on rat bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on parental reproduction and offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of moderate irritation observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In the available rabbit skin irritation tests, the affected animals exhibited a Draize score of 0.2 at 1 hour after application, but all signs cleared up by 24 hours (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests employing the Buehler method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (systemic toxicity)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "reduced locomotor activity," "abnormal gait," "prone position," "hypopnea," "lacrimation," "reddish tear," "exophthalmos" and "cyanosis" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)). No target organs were identified from these findings. These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
